result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Cline Smith II

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF343, 22CF36, 22CF57, 22CF414, and 22CF192. State notes that no victims plan to attend the hearings today. In 22CF343, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Attorney Rosenthal notes that the defendant just finished an assessment in Duluth. There is a joint request for another status.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal states defendant on wait for assessment and asks for another status in October. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases. in 22CF192, acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accept pleas.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF141, Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Attorney Rosenthal asks for status in 45 days and asks for bail modification hearing next week. Court also sets bail/bond hearing on 22CF192. Attorney Rosenthal asks for a waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF192. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court binds over for arraignment.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:59 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. 
Court lets defendant know that the court received information that the address provided is not where he resides.
Defendant confirms that is where he is staying.
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:46 PM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Rosenthal.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requests 1500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
has pending cases, was late for PH in 2/2022, has 1000 cb posted in one and 2000cb in the other.  Currently on MN F probation, has a number of fta's and priors in WI. Reviews MN history
Attorney Rosenthal makes argument; lifelong 20 year resident, family ties, significant amount posted on other cases makes him less of flight risk, no ability to post cash, request 500cb.
Court indicates concerns, fta's, on felony bonds, on probation
Court orders 1500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
